questions.question: Which of the following elements is not something you'd include in your spot fleet request?
questions.response_message: The availability zone, target capacity, and AMI are all elements of a complete spot fleet request.

questions.question: Which of the following services can alert you to malware on an EC2 instance?
questions.response_message: GuardDuty looks for potentially malicious activity. Inspector looks for vulnerabilities that may result in compromise. Shield and Web Application Firewall protect applications from attack.

questions.question: If you need to allow a user full control over EC2 instance resources, which two of the following must be included in the policy you create?
questions.response_message: The correct Resource line would read 'Resource': '*'. There is no 'Target' line in an IAM policy.

questions.question: In a multi-AZ deployment using Oracle, how is data replicated?
choices: Synchronously from the primary instance to a read replica
Asynchronously from the primary to a standby instance
Synchronously from the primary to a standby instance
questions.response_message: Multi-AZ deployments using Oracle, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, MySQL, or Microsoft SQL Server replicate data synchronously from the primary to a standby instance. Only a multi-AZ deployment using Aurora uses a cluster volume and replicates data to a specific type of read replica called an Aurora replica.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a major design consideration for a managed RDS database?
questions.response_message: Scalability is managed automatically by RDS. Indexes, schemas, and views should be optimized as much as possible.

questions.question: Which of the following can be used to audit the changes made to your account and resource configurations?
questions.response_message: CloudTrail tracks API calls. CloudWatch monitors system performance. CodePipeline is a CI/CD orchestration service.

questions.question: You want to use Route 53 to send users to the application load balancer closest to them. Which of the following routing policies lets you do this with the least effort?
questions.response_message: Geoproximity routing routes users to the location closest to them. Geolocation routing requires you to create records for specific locations or create a default record. See Chapter 8 for more information.

questions.question: You need to manually take EBS snapshots of several hundred volumes. Which type of Systems Manager document enables you to do this?
questions.response_message: Automation documents let you perform actions against your AWS resources, including taking EBS snapshots. Although called automation documents, you can still manually execute them. A command document performs actions within a Linux or Windows instance. A policy document works only with State Manager and can't take an EBS snapshot. There's no manual document type.

questions.question: Your security policy requires that you use a KMS key for encrypting S3 objects. It further requires this key be rotated once a year and revoked when misuse is detected. Which key type should you use? (Choose two.)
questions.response_message: You can revoke and rotate both a customer-managed CMK and a customer-provided key at will. You can't revoke or rotate an AWS-managed CMK or an S3-managed key.

questions.question: You attempt to connect with Secure Shell (SSH) to an EC2 instance using a public IP address given to you by a colleague. You successfully connect, but it's not the instance you were expecting. Every time you try, you connect to a different instance. What could be the problem?
choices: You're connecting to the IP address of a network load balancer
You're connecting to the instance's elastic IP address
You must use the instance's public domain name
You're connectingn to the IP address of an application load balancer
questions.response_message: The fact that you connect to a different instance every time suggests you're connecting to a network load balancer. An application load balancer would not pass SSH traffic through to the instance.

questions.question: How many database engines can an RDS database instance run?
questions.response_message: Although there are six database engines to choose from, a single database instance can run only one database engine. If you want to run more than one database engine, you will need a separate database instance for each engine.

questions.question: If your application is down for 45 minutes a year, what is its approximate availability?
questions.response_message: 99.99 percent availability corresponds to about 52 minutes of downtime per year. 99 percent, 99.9 percent, and 99.95 percent entail significantly more downtime.

questions.question: In a relational database, a row may also be called what? (Choose two.)
questions.response_message: Different relational databases use different terminology. A row, record, and tuple all describe an ordered set of columns. An attribute is another term for column. A table contains rows and columns.

questions.question: You've configured CloudTrail to log all management events in all regions. Which of the following API events will CloudTrail log? (Choose two.)
choices: Creating an S3 bucket from the web console
Uploading an object to an S3 bucket
Creating a subnet using the AWS CLI
questions.response_message: Creating a bucket and subnet are API actions, regardless of whether they're performed from the web console or AWS CLI. Uploading an object to an S3 bucket is a data event, not a management event. Logging into the AWS console is a non-API management event.

questions.question: Which element has no effect in an identity-based policy?
questions.response_message: The principal element is not used in an identity-based policy. Operation, effect, and condition all have effects in an identity-based policy.

questions.question: What solution allows you to deploy HPC applications that require massive inter-instance communications at scale that used the Scalable Reliable Datagram (SRD) protocol to improve the speed and latency of inter-instance communications?
questions.response_message: The Elastic Fabric Adapter (EFA) is an EC2 network device that improves throughput and scalability of HPC. FsX is a Windows file storage offering, Luster is also an HPC solution but does not use the SRD protocol, and EC2 placement groups would help with HPC but do not specifically use elastic fabric adapters.

questions.question: You plan on a long-running EMR cluster for your companyâ€™s big data Hadoop application. In order to cost-optimize the task nodes, what instance options would best fit your needs?
questions.response_message: For long running instances, the most cost-effective offering from AWS is a reserved instance type. On demand is the most expensive, and spot is the cheapest but can be terminated. Lambda is serverless and not applicable to long-running clusters such as EMR. A task node can tolerate spot instances terminating as they do not store data locally.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about a new subnet created in a custom VPC that was set up with the default configuration?
choices: It will require a new route table to be created
It can communicate with other subnets across availability zones
It will not have a NACL associated with it
It will have an Internet Gateway attached automatically
questions.response_message: All custom VPCs will have a route table and NACL upon creation but not an Internet Gateway.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a valid attribute for an elastic network interface?
questions.response_message: Elastic network interfaces do not have routing tables, but they can have IPv4 and IPv6 addresses and a source/destination check flag.

questions.question: Which of the following offers the largest range of IP addresses?
questions.response_message: A /16 offers 65,536 IP addresses. The lower the number, the larger the pool of IP addresses when using CIDR notation.

questions.question: For which of the following storage classes do you need to specify an availability zone?
questions.response_message: While S3 does use availability zones to store objects in buckets, you do not choose the availability zone yourself. Even S3 One Zone-IA does not allow you to specify the AZ for use.

questions.question: What service allows you to deploy your code with minimal oversight?
questions.response_message: Elastic Beanstalk can deploy your code and handle capacity provisioning, load balancing, and setting up auto-scaling and health checks, all with very little oversight.

questions.question: Which of the following provides low latency access to all data while still storing the dataset in the cloud?
questions.response_message: A storage gateway using stored volumes will store all data locally while backing up the data to S3 in AWS as well.

questions.question: Which of the following are appropriate password policy requirements? (Choose two.)
questions.response_message: A good password policy has minimum length and complexity requirements.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is false?
choices: A subnet cannot span multiple availability zones
A VPC can peer with no more than two other VPCs
A VPC peering connection does not support transitive routing
A VPC can peer with VPCs in other AWS accounts
questions.response_message: A VPC can peer with unlimited other VPCs. A subnet cannot span AZs, a VPC can peer with VPCs in other accounts

questions.question: Which of the following does a VPC endpoint require?
questions.response_message: A VPC endpoint does not require any of these to connect

questions.question: What languages can you use with SWF?
choices: Java, Node, Elixir, Rust, Python, Golang
questions.response_message: SWF places no language restraints on your workflow, as long as interactions can be managed via HTTP requests and responses.

questions.question: Which of the following can flow logs NOT be created for?
questions.response_message: Flow Logs allow you to capture IP traffic information and can be created at the VPC, subnet, or network interface level.

questions.question: Which of the following sections of a CloudFormation template is required?
questions.response_message: Templates include several major sections. The Resources section is the only required section.

questions.question: Which of the following can asynchronously trigger a Lambda function?
questions.response_message: ALB, Cognito, Lex, Alexa, API Gateway, CloudFront, and Kinesis Data Firehose are all valid direct (synchronous) triggers for Lambda functions. S3 is one of the valid asynchronous triggers.
